concept.title: Rights Manager API Tutorial
concept.shortdesc: Applications can use the ContentAccess::CRightsManager class to manage Digital Rights Management (DRM) rights within a particular DRM agent.

section.title: Required background
section.p: Before you start, you must understand:

section.title: Introduction
section.p: Rights Manager API gives simple access to the rights within a CAF agent implementing a DRM scheme. The rights are represented in a generic form using the ContentAccess::CRightsInfo class. This class holds a text description of the rights and some simple properties associated with these rights.
Rights Manager API also allows applications to determine which content files are associated with each rights object and vice versa.

section.title: Procedure

li.p: Create a DRM rights management object.
Perform one or more of the following tasks as per your requirement:
List the rights associated with a content file.
List the rights associated with a content object.
List the content associated with a rights object.

p.b: Create a DRM rights management object

section.p: The ContentAccess::CRightsManagerobject is created by the ContentAccess::CManager object to look at the rights stored by a particular content access agent.
The CRightsManager::ListAllRightsL() function produces a list of all the rights stored in the given DRM agent.

p.b: List the rights associated with a content file

section.p: The CRightsManager::ListRightsL() function produces a list of all the rights stored in the given DRM agent that are associated with the file at a given URI.

p.b: List the rights associated with a content object

section.p: The CRightsManager::ListRightsL() function produces a list of all the rights stored in the given DRM agent that are associated with the content object at a given virtual path.

p.b: List the content associated with a rights object

section.p: The CRightsManager::GetRightsDataL() function allows an application to retrieve a pointer to a rights object. The rights object is derived from MAgentRightsBase.
It is also possible to delete all the rights associated with a particular content object.
section.codeblock: // Delete all the rights objects associated with the given content object TInt result = rightsManager->DeleteAllRights(virtualPath);
